alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Maryland, including the following county: St. Marys. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work downstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 PM EDT, the stream gauge on the St. Marys River at Great Mills indicated minor flooding was occurring. Flooding may also be occurring in other locations within the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - The St. Marys River has crested and floodwaters will slowly recede through the remainder of the night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington Park... Leonardtown... Greenwell State Park... California... Hollywood... Redgate... Tintop Hill... Callaway... Hillville... Sotterley... Great Mills...
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
